item.title: Pickup command with restrictions
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:451627”] final int[] RESTRICTED = { 1050, 1051 }; for (int element : RESTRICTED) { if (element == itemId && p.playerRights != 3) { p.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); return; } }

Edit: @Kingman, that is the same code you just split the condition…[/quote]
Instead of trying to prove how kewl u can codez and spoonfeeding him the answer, why don’t you tell him what the problem is and how to fix it in words not code.

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup command with restrictions
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:451627”] final int[] RESTRICTED = { 1050, 1051 }; for (int element : RESTRICTED) { if (element == itemId && p.playerRights != 3) { p.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); return; } }

Edit: @Kingman, that is the same code you just split the condition…[/quote]

p.s: for bigger arrays you can use a binary search.

en.wikipedia.org

Binary search algorithm

In computer science, binary search, also known as half-interval search, logarithmic search, or binary chop, is a search algorithm that finds the position of a target value within a sorted array. Binary search compares the target value to the middle element of the array; if they are unequal, the half in which the target cannot lie is eliminated and the search continues on the remaining half until it is successful. If the search ends with the remaining half being empty, the target is Binary search ...

item.title: Pickup command with restrictions
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

final int[] RESTRICTED = { 1050, 1051 };
for (int element : RESTRICTED) {
    if (element == itemId && p.playerRights != 3) {
        p.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item.");
        return;
    }
}

Edit: @Kingman, that is the same code you just split the condition…

Read full topic

.\com\iClarity\player\packetHandler\Packets\Commands.java:172: incompatible type s found : int[] required: boolean if(restrictedItems) { ^ 1 error

item.title: Pickup command with restrictions
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“dwarvenknight, post:1, topic:451627”]My base is iClarity and I have a pickup command but I want to make restrictions so you could pickup everything except a santa hat for example. Here’s what I have so far:

int restrictedItems[] = {1050, 1051}; if(restrictedItems && p.playerRights != 3) { p.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); return;

All I get are errors.[/quote]
According to the errors, you can’t use && with the int[], and boolean.
Try this:

if(restrictedItems) { if(p.playerRights != 3) { p.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); } } It might work.

Read full topic
